item.title: Adding Fletching via arrow making & ItemOnItem to basic servers/dodian
item.dc:creator: @statsflamescape statsflamescape
item.description:
@statsflamescape wrote:

If you using Delta heres the proper codes:

if(((itemUsed == 946) && (otherItem == 1511))){ deleteItem(1511, getItemSlot(1511), 1); setAnimation(885); addItem(52, 15); addSkillXP(700, 9); sM("You cut the logs into some arrow shafts."); } if(((itemUsed == 314) && (otherItem == 52))){ deleteItem(314, getItemSlot(314), 15); deleteItem(52, getItemSlot(52), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(52, 15); addSkillXP(550, 9); sM("You attach feathers to the arrow shafts."); } if(((itemUsed == 39) && (otherItem == 53))){ deleteItem(39, getItemSlot(39), 15); deleteItem(53, getItemSlot(53), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(882, 15); addSkillXP(1000, 9); sM("You fit Bronze arrow heads to the headless arrows."); } if(((itemUsed == 40) && (otherItem == 53))){ deleteItem(40, getItemSlot(40), 15); deleteItem(53, getItemSlot(53), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(884, 15); addSkillXP(2000, 9); sM("You fit Iron arrow heads to the headless arrows."); } if(((itemUsed == 41) && (otherItem == 53))){ deleteItem(41, getItemSlot(41), 15); deleteItem(53, getItemSlot(53), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(886, 15); addSkillXP(3000, 9); sM("You fit Steel arrow heads to the headless arrows."); } if(((itemUsed == 42) && (otherItem == 53))){ deleteItem(42, getItemSlot(42), 15); deleteItem(53, getItemSlot(53), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(888, 15); addSkillXP(4000, 9); sM("You fit Mithril arrow heads to the headless arrows."); } if(((itemUsed == 43) && (otherItem == 53))){ deleteItem(43, getItemSlot(43), 15); deleteItem(53, getItemSlot(53), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(890, 15); addSkillXP(5000, 9); sM("You fit Adamant arrow heads to the headless arrows."); } if(((itemUsed == 44) && (otherItem == 53))){ deleteItem(44, getItemSlot(44), 15); deleteItem(53, getItemSlot(53), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(892, 15); addSkillXP(10000, 9); sM("You fit Rune arrow heads to the headless arrows."); }

There is a glitches i has notice while the test… and i wna know how to fix this problem
The glitch is that is you only have like 5 or 1 or any amount of arrows tops its make 15 arrows… EX: 5 rune tips = 15 rune arrows
is there a way to fix it so if you have 5 you can only make 5…

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Fletching via arrow making & ItemOnItem to basic servers/dodian
item.dc:creator: @JaydenD12 JaydenD12
item.description:
@JaydenD12 wrote:

[quote=“Insomniac Riot, post:14, topic:337342”][quote author=JaydenD12 link=topic=433745.msg3185815#msg3185815 date=1271722646]
Your shit shortened:

[code]public int[] itemUsed = {39, 40, 41, 42, 43, 44};

for (int i = 0; i < itemUsed.length; i++)
{
if (itemUsed == itemUsed[i] && useWith == 53)
{
deleteItem(itemUsed[i], getItemSlot(itemUsed[i], 15);
deleteItem(53, getItemSlot(53]), 15);
setAnimation(885);
addItem(892, 15);
addSkillXp(10000, 9);
sendMessage(“You fit " + getItemName(itemUsed[i]) + " to the headless arrows.”);
}
}[/code]
[/quote]

Yes, that is shortened, but I put level requirements, experience changes, ect. Plus in the first deleteItem, you forgot an ending ) as the second int.[/quote]

Yeah my bad, I was rushing cause I had to get to class.

item.title: Adding Fletching via arrow making & ItemOnItem to basic servers/dodian
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Insomniac Riot, post:11, topic:337342”]No you didn’t. You set it so no matter how many of the items they have, they get 15 in return. I’ll show you a much easier way to do fletching with arrows.

[code]
for (int i = 0; i < arrowheads.length; i++){
if(((itemUsed == 53) || (usedWith == 53)) && ((itemUsed == arrowheads[i]) || (usedWith == arrowheads[i]))){

		if(playerLevel[9] < requiredLevel[i]){
			sM("Your Fletching level must be atleast " + requiredLevel[i] + " to do this.");
			return;
		} else if(playerHasAmount(53, 15) && playerHasAmount(arrowheads[i], 15)){
			deleteItem(arrowheads[i], 15);
			deleteItem(53, 15);
			addItem(arrows, 15);
			addSkillXP(experience[i], 9);
		} else
			sM("You must have 15 Arrow Heads and 15 Headless Arrows to do this.");
	}
}[/code]

Then use these arrays:

	public static int[] arrowheads = { 39, 40, 41, 42, 43, 44 };
	public static int[] arrows = { 882, 884, 886, 888, 890, 892 };
	public static int[] requiredLevel = { 1, 15, 30, 45, 60, 75 };
	public static int[] experience = { 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 };

I leave the experience to you.[/quote]

It can be done even better.

@Topic this is like 2007 work, use proper conventions, and call it from a class dumbie.

Read full topic
item.source: Adding Fletching via arrow making & ItemOnItem to basic servers/dodian

item.title: Adding Fletching via arrow making & ItemOnItem to basic servers/dodian
item.dc:creator: @Insomniac_Riot Insomniac Riot
item.description:
@Insomniac_Riot wrote:

No you didn’t. You set it so no matter how many of the items they have, they get 15 in return. I’ll show you a much easier way to do fletching with arrows.

[code]
for (int i = 0; i < arrowheads.length; i++){
if(((itemUsed == 53) || (usedWith == 53)) && ((itemUsed == arrowheads[i]) || (usedWith == arrowheads[i]))){

		if(playerLevel[9] < requiredLevel[i]){
			sM("Your Fletching level must be atleast " + requiredLevel[i] + " to do this.");
			return;
		} else if(playerHasAmount(53, 15) && playerHasAmount(arrowheads[i], 15)){
			deleteItem(arrowheads[i], 15);
			deleteItem(53, 15);
			addItem(arrows, 15);
			addSkillXP(experience[i], 9);
		} else
			sM("You must have 15 Arrow Heads and 15 Headless Arrows to do this.");
	}
}[/code]

Then use these arrays:

	public static int[] arrowheads = { 39, 40, 41, 42, 43, 44 };
	public static int[] arrows = { 882, 884, 886, 888, 890, 892 };
	public static int[] requiredLevel = { 1, 15, 30, 45, 60, 75 };
	public static int[] experience = { 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 };

I leave the experience to you.

Read full topic
item.source: Adding Fletching via arrow making & ItemOnItem to basic servers/dodian

item.title: Adding Fletching via arrow making & ItemOnItem to basic servers/dodian
item.dc:creator: @The_Unholy The Unholy
item.description:
@The_Unholy wrote:

I’ve set it so you need at least 15, and it removes 15. Look at the code

deleteItem(39, getItemSlot(39), 15); <- 15 Deletes 15 Heads
deleteItem(53, getItemSlot(53), 15); <- 15 Deletes 15 headless arrows
addItem(882, 15);

Adds 15 arrows, and yeah, I know Arrays are much simpler, but this method works, so it’s an alternative.

Read full topic
item.source: Adding Fletching via arrow making & ItemOnItem to basic servers/dodian

item.title: Adding Fletching via arrow making & ItemOnItem to basic servers/dodian
item.dc:creator: @Insomniac_Riot Insomniac Riot
item.description:
@Insomniac_Riot wrote:

Not to be mean or anything, put there is a much simplier way to do this, using arrays. Also, the experience rate is way to high, and don’t you need at least 15 arrow shafts, arrow heads, and feathers? That way, people don’t have to just do one at a time to get experience out of it.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Fletching via arrow making & ItemOnItem to basic servers/dodian
item.dc:creator: @The_Unholy The Unholy
item.description:
@The_Unholy wrote:

Difficulty: 0/10
Files modified: Client.java
Sources tested: Devolution

[size=18pt]Okay, if you have an Itemonitem.java file, open it and follow on, if not, scroll down to the Client.java method[/size]

Scroll down until you find a few lines of code that start with this;

if(itemUsed == #### && useWith == ####) {

Under the ‘}’

Paste this

if(itemUsed == 946 && useWith == 1511) { deleteItem(1511, getItemSlot(1511), 1); setAnimation(885); addItem(52, 15); addSkillXP(700, 9); sendMessage("You cut the logs into some arrow shafts."); } if(itemUsed == 314 && useWith == 52) { deleteItem(314, getItemSlot(314), 15); deleteItem(52, getItemSlot(52), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(52, 15); addSkillXP(550, 9); sendMessage("You attach feathers to the arrow shafts."); } if(itemUsed == 39 && useWith == 53) { deleteItem(39, getItemSlot(39), 15); deleteItem(53, getItemSlot(53), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(882, 15); addSkillXP(1000, 9); sendMessage("You fit Bronze arrow heads to the headless arrows."); } if(itemUsed == 40 && useWith == 53) { deleteItem(40, getItemSlot(40), 15); deleteItem(53, getItemSlot(53), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(884, 15); addSkillXP(2000, 9); sendMessage("You fit Iron arrow heads to the headless arrows."); } if(itemUsed == 41 && useWith == 53) { deleteItem(41, getItemSlot(41), 15); deleteItem(53, getItemSlot(53), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(886, 15); addSkillXP(3000, 9); sendMessage("You fit Steel arrow heads to the headless arrows."); } if(itemUsed == 42 && useWith == 53) { deleteItem(42, getItemSlot(42), 15); deleteItem(53, getItemSlot(53), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(888, 15); addSkillXP(4000, 9); sendMessage("You fit Mithril arrow heads to the headless arrows."); } if(itemUsed == 43 && useWith == 53) { deleteItem(43, getItemSlot(43), 15); deleteItem(53, getItemSlot(53), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(890, 15); addSkillXP(5000, 9); sendMessage("You fit Adamant arrow heads to the headless arrows."); } if(itemUsed == 44 && useWith == 53) { deleteItem(44, getItemSlot(44), 15); deleteItem(53, getItemSlot(53), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(892, 15); addSkillXP(10000, 9); sendMessage("You fit Rune arrow heads to the headless arrows."); }

This means that using knives on logs, will create arrow shafts, using feathers on arrow shafts will create headless arrows, and using arrow tips on headless arrows will create the corresponding arrow, depending on the tip used.

[size=18pt]If you don’t have Itemonitem.java…[/size]

Open up Client.java
and search for

case 53

Scroll down until you find a few lines of code that start with this;

if(itemUsed == #### && useWith == ####) {

Under the ‘}’

Paste this

if(itemUsed == 946 && useWith == 1511) { deleteItem(1511, getItemSlot(1511), 1); setAnimation(885); addItem(52, 15); addSkillXP(700, 9); sendMessage("You cut the logs into some arrow shafts."); } if(itemUsed == 314 && useWith == 52) { deleteItem(314, getItemSlot(314), 15); deleteItem(52, getItemSlot(52), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(52, 15); addSkillXP(550, 9); sendMessage("You attach feathers to the arrow shafts."); } if(itemUsed == 39 && useWith == 53) { deleteItem(39, getItemSlot(39), 15); deleteItem(53, getItemSlot(53), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(882, 15); addSkillXP(1000, 9); sendMessage("You fit Bronze arrow heads to the headless arrows."); } if(itemUsed == 40 && useWith == 53) { deleteItem(40, getItemSlot(40), 15); deleteItem(53, getItemSlot(53), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(884, 15); addSkillXP(2000, 9); sendMessage("You fit Iron arrow heads to the headless arrows."); } if(itemUsed == 41 && useWith == 53) { deleteItem(41, getItemSlot(41), 15); deleteItem(53, getItemSlot(53), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(886, 15); addSkillXP(3000, 9); sendMessage("You fit Steel arrow heads to the headless arrows."); } if(itemUsed == 42 && useWith == 53) { deleteItem(42, getItemSlot(42), 15); deleteItem(53, getItemSlot(53), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(888, 15); addSkillXP(4000, 9); sendMessage("You fit Mithril arrow heads to the headless arrows."); } if(itemUsed == 43 && useWith == 53) { deleteItem(43, getItemSlot(43), 15); deleteItem(53, getItemSlot(53), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(890, 15); addSkillXP(5000, 9); sendMessage("You fit Adamant arrow heads to the headless arrows."); } if(itemUsed == 44 && useWith == 53) { deleteItem(44, getItemSlot(44), 15); deleteItem(53, getItemSlot(53), 15); setAnimation(885); addItem(892, 15); addSkillXP(10000, 9); sendMessage("You fit Rune arrow heads to the headless arrows."); }

I hope this helps, you now have a basic fletching base via Itemonitem
